page.title: 12The Parish Council
page.content: Milburn parish council has five members and a parish clerk. It is responsible for looking after the interests of the village and villagers and planning for the future. most recently they have been involved in a project to build six 3 bedroomed houses.The building began 1 July 1985. The parish council is also involved in discussions concerning the parking of vehicles during the Appelby annual garthing of gypsies for the horse fair. All planning applications are sent to the parish council and then forwarded to the planning Department of the Eden District council.They are responsible for parks,playing fields, swimming pools, health and council housing. The District councils form Cumbria County Council which is responsible for roads,education and the fire service.
